alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 1:34AM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches. Isolated areas above 9500 feet elevation could see up to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph through Wednesday morning before dissipating to gusts near 40-50mph by late Wednesday afternoon. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
